sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Flowers</radical> find their <radical>death</radical> in a <radical>river</radical> out in the <kanji>wild</kanji>. Flowers live on water, but this river drowns the flowers to death. The wild is a dangerous place.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself out in the wild wilderness as you hear the flowers screaming until death takes them. The river is raging, there’s nothing you can do to help the flowers. The wild has claimed them.
readingMnemonic: <reading>Ah</reading> (<ja>あ</ja>), the flowers in the <kanji>wild</kanji> have been claimed <reading>à la</reading> (<ja>あら</ja>) the great flood. Ah, you don’t think so? Well I do.
readingInfo: Imagine this scene again, only imagine it like the wild flowers are experiencing their own great flood. Ah, those flowers are drowning to death à la everything that died in the Biblical flood.
